com.cleo.lexicom.scripts

Interface ISessionScript


  • public interface ISessionScript
    Establishes an interface with VersaLex available within a script. The following built-in JavaScript shell variables and functions are also available:
    Variable/FunctionDescription
    argumentsContains the arguments passed to the script.
    environmentReturns the current environment object.
    help()Display usage and help messages.
    load(["foo.js",...])Load JavaScript source files name by string arguments.
    loadClass(className)Load a class named by a string argument. The class must be a script compiled to a class file.
    print([expr ...])Evaluate and print expressions to console.
    importPackage(package)Provides functionality similar to Java's "import" statement.
    quit()Stop execution of the current script environment.
    version([number])Get or set the JavaScript version number.
    gc()Runs the garbage collector.
    spawn(arg)Evaluate function or script name on a new thread.
    sync(function [,obj])Creates a synchronized version of the function, where the synchronization object is the obj argument or "this" if obj is undefined.
    readFile(fileName [,encoding])Returns the content of the file as a string. Encoding of the string can be optionally specified.
    readUrl(url [,encoding])Similar to readFile, reads the contents of the url.
    runCommand(name ...)Runs a specified shell command. Additional arguments are passed to the command.
    seal(args ...)Seals the supplied objects (so they may not be modified - read-only).
    toint32(arg)Converts the argument into a 32-bit integer.
    serialize(obj, fileName)Serializes an object and saves it to a file.
    deserialize(fileName)Reconstructs a serialized object.

      • hasProperty

        boolean hasProperty(int type,
                    java.lang.String property)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Check if property exists
        Parameters:
        type - either HOST, MAILBOX, ACTION, or HOST_ACTION
        property - the property name requested
        Returns:
        true if property exists
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

                               java.lang.String property)
                        throws java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:
        type - either HOST, MAILBOX, ACTION, or HOST_ACTION
        property - the property name requested
        Returns:
        the property value (if the property is not an array, a single entry array is returned)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(int type,
                 java.lang.String property,
                 java.lang.String value)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Set property value

        Warning: The set value is changed in memory and saved permanently when the action finishes. This means that setProperty() can reliably be used only if - actions are not allowed to run concurrently OR - for a mailbox property there is only one action in the mailbox OR - for a host property there is only one action in the host.

        Parameters:
        type - either HOST, MAILBOX, ACTION, or HOST_ACTION
        property - the property name requested
        value - the property value
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(int type,
                 java.lang.String property,
                 java.lang.String[] value)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Set property values

        Warning: The set value is changed in memory and saved permanently when the action finishes. This means that setProperty() can reliably be used only if - actions are not allowed to run concurrently OR - for a mailbox property there is only one action in the mailbox OR - for a host property there is only one action in the host.

        Parameters:
        type - either HOST, MAILBOX, ACTION, or HOST_ACTION
        property - the property name requested
        value - the property values
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • applyDefaultBox

        java.lang.String applyDefaultBox(java.lang.String local,
                                 boolean inbox)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        If local is a relative path, apply the default inbox/outbox settings
        Parameters:
        local - a relative or absolute path
        inbox - true if local is inbound path; false if local is outbound path
        Returns:
        potentially adjusted local path
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getMailboxController

        IMailboxController getMailboxController(java.lang.String[] path)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Get a mailbox controller for another host\\mailbox. Only available in standalone actions
        Parameters:
        path - the alias path to the host and/or mailbox. The host and/or mailbox must be in the same host tree branch (or below) as the standalone action.
        Returns:
        the mailbox controller
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getActionController

        IActionController getActionController(java.lang.String[] path)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Get an action controller for another host\\mailbox\\action. Only available in standalone actions
        Parameters:
        path - the alias path to the action. The action must be in the same host tree branch (or below) as the standalone action.
        Returns:
        the action controller
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getHostProtocol

        int getHostProtocol()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the protocol for the host
        Returns:
        either HTTP_CLIENT/_SERVER, FTP_CLIENT/_SERVER, OFTP_CLIENT, SSHFTP_CLIENT/_SERVER, MQ_CLIENT, SMTP_CLIENT, or MLLP_CLIENT
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getMailboxPackaging

        int getMailboxPackaging()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the packaging for the mailbox
        Returns:
        either NONE, AS2, AS3, ebMS, RNIF, OpenPGP, XML Encryption, or WS
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • logDetail

        void logDetail(java.lang.String logMessage)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Write a message to the XML log relative to this script instance
        Parameters:
        logMessage - the message to write
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if this method is used in the thread which did not execute the script an exception will be thrown.

      • logDetail

        void logDetail(java.lang.String logMessage,
               int level,
               java.lang.String color)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Write a message to the XML log relative to this script instance
        Parameters:
        logMessage - the message to write
        level - the message log level
        color - the message color (e.g. black, red, or orange)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if this method is used in the thread which did not execute the script an exception will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        command - command to execute
        Returns:
        True if successful
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getTrigger

        Trigger getTrigger()
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the event trigger which initiated execution of the script.
        Returns:
        the event trigger; null if the script was not initiated from a trigger
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • isResending

        boolean isResending()
             throws LexiComException
        Indicates whether this action is resend run type.
        Returns:
        true if action is a resend; false otherwise
        Throws:
        LexiComException - is thrown if this is not invoked from within an action.

      • getResends

        LexiComOutgoing[] getResends()
                      throws LexiComException
        Get object(s) to be resent. Note: Multiple resends can only occur when the original transfers were part of a multiple file payload transfer. Example usage: if (ISessionScript.isResending()) { // resend, possibly multiple payload actionController.put(["-MUL"], ISessionScript.getResends(), null, null); } else { // basic send ... }
        Returns:
        LexiComOutgoing object(s) associated with file(s) to be resent.
        Throws:
        LexiComException - is thrown if this is not invoked from within an action or if the action is not a resend run type.

      • getLogListeners

        LogListeners getLogListeners()
                      throws LexiComException
        Add/list/remove log listeners
        Returns:
        log listeners management interface
        Throws:
        LexiComException

      • getIncomingFilters

        IncomingFilters getIncomingFilters()
                            throws LexiComException
        Add/list/remove incoming filters
        Returns:
        incoming filters management interface
        Throws:
        LexiComException

      • runScriptAction

        java.lang.Object runScriptAction(java.lang.String alias,
                                 java.lang.String... args)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Run a (Java)script action
        Parameters:
        alias - the relative alias of the script action; can be a standalone, host, or mailbox action (if accessible)
        args - the optional set of arguments to pass to the action
        Returns:
        the exit code of the scripted action; null if not defined
        Throws:
        LexiComException
        java.lang.Exception

      • runScriptAction

        java.lang.Object runScriptAction(java.lang.String[] path,
                                 java.lang.String... args)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Run a (Java)script action
        Parameters:
        path - the absolute alias path to the script action; can be a standalone, host, or mailbox action (if accessible)
        args - the optional set of arguments to pass to the action
        Returns:
        the exit code of the scripted action; null if not defined
        Throws:
        LexiComException
        java.lang.Exception
